ffmpeg.not_installed_detail: VideoTool requires FFmpeg to process video files. Some features (track merge, subtitle muxing, etc.) will not be available.

merge.title: Audio/Video Merge
merge.ffmpegNotAvailableDetail: FFmpeg component failed to load. Audio/Video merge is unavailable.
merge.note1: Supported video formats: MP4, MKV, AVI, MOV, etc.
merge.note2: Supported audio formats: MP3, AAC, WAV, FLAC, etc.
merge.note3: Using 'Copy' mode avoids re-encoding for faster processing
merge.note4: Hardware acceleration can significantly improve speed
merge.selectFilesFirst: Please select video and audio files first

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.language_hint: Note: Some UI elements will update immediately

about.title: VideoTool
about.subtitle: Powerful Cross-Platform Video Processing Tool ¬∑ Open Source & Free ¬∑ v{{version}}
about.introText1: is a powerful cross-platform video processing tool dedicated to providing simple and efficient video processing solutions.
about.introText2: Supports subtitle format conversion, audio/video merging, subtitle burning and more, making video processing simpler and faster.
about.feature1: Convert between three mainstream subtitle formats: SRT, ASS, and VTT. Batch processing mode allows converting multiple subtitle files at once. Built-in rich style templates and custom style editor for fine-tuning fonts, colors, positions, outlines, and more. Intelligent cleanup removes extra spaces and special characters to ensure proper subtitle formatting. Preview feature lets you see the results before conversion.
about.feature2: Quickly merge separate video and audio tracks into complete video files. Supports multiple encoding formats with options to copy streams directly or re-encode. Hardware acceleration options (VideoToolbox, NVENC, QSV, etc.) significantly boost processing speed and reduce CPU usage. Batch merge multiple sets of audio/video files for improved efficiency.
about.feature3: Embed external subtitle files into video containers or burn them directly onto the video frames. Embed mode preserves original subtitle streams for toggling during playback. Burn mode permanently embeds subtitles into video frames, ideal for sharing and high compatibility scenarios. Multiple quality presets and custom encoding parameters for flexible control over output quality and file size. Hardware acceleration for fast processing of large files.
about.feature4: Powerful video transcoding supporting mainstream formats like MP4, MKV, AVI. AI analysis mode automatically recommends optimal encoding parameters based on video content and usage scenarios. Manual mode offers fine-grained control over encoder, bitrate, resolution, frame rate, filters, and more. Multi-track muxing to preserve or select audio and subtitle tracks. Rich preset templates for different scenarios like mobile devices and streaming platforms.
about.tech1: Built with Electron + React + TypeScript for quality and performance
about.tech2: Native support for macOS, Windows, and Linux operating systems
about.tech3: Supports VideoToolbox, NVENC, QSV and other acceleration solutions
about.tech4: Clean and intuitive interface focusing on user experience
about.tech5: Powered by FFmpeg multimedia framework, robust and reliable
about.licenseText: This software is licensed under the MIT License and is completely free to use. You are free to use, modify, and distribute this software.

subtitleBurn.title: Subtitle Burn
subtitleBurn.subtitle: Subtitle
subtitleBurn.softSubtitleDesc: Soft subtitle: Toggleable, MKV preserves styles, MP4 loses styles, 100% video quality retained.
subtitleBurn.hardSubtitleDesc: Hard subtitle: Burned into video, high compatibility, requires re-encoding.
subtitleBurn.videoCodecDesc: H.265 is smaller, H.264 has better compatibility
subtitleBurn.tuneDesc: film recommended for H.264, use grain for grainy footage
subtitleBurn.encodingSpeedDesc: Slower is clearer with smaller file size
subtitleBurn.advancedTip: Subtitle burning requires video re-encoding. Currently using software encoding (high quality). Switch to hardware acceleration preset above for faster speed.
subtitleBurn.progressWait: Burning process requires re-encoding, please wait patiently...
subtitleBurn.ffmpegNotAvailableDetail: FFmpeg component failed to load. Subtitle burning is unavailable.
subtitleBurn.guideHardSubtitle: Hard Subtitle: Burned into video, requires re-encoding, high compatibility
subtitleBurn.guideSoftSubtitle: Soft Subtitle: Toggleable, instant processing, 100% quality preserved
subtitleBurn.guideMkvAss: MKV + ASS: Fully preserves subtitle styles (Recommended)
subtitleBurn.guideMp4MovText: MP4 + mov_text: Loses styles but better compatibility
subtitleBurn.guideAdvantage: Advantage: Direct video/audio copy, no quality loss

transcode.title: Video Transcode
transcode.scene.mobileDesc: Optimized for phones/tablets, small size and high compatibility
transcode.scene.compressDesc: Minimum file size for limited storage
transcode.scene.customDesc: Intelligently adjusted based on video characteristics
transcode.aiModeDesc: AI automatically analyzes video parameters and recommends the best transcoding solution. Suitable for general users to quickly complete transcoding tasks.
transcode.manualModeDesc: Full control over all transcoding parameters, suitable for professional users to fine-tune.
transcode.noApiKeyHint: üí° Rule-based engine will be used when API Key is not configured (fast & free)
transcode.filterHint: Filters will increase transcoding time, use as needed
transcode.compressionHint: Compress dynamic range for more balanced volume
transcode.audioHint: Audio processing may affect quality, keep original or light adjustments recommended
transcode.hwaccelHint: Hardware acceleration can significantly improve transcoding speed
transcode.subtitlesHint: Burning subtitles will permanently embed them into the video
transcode.fastStartHint: Move metadata to file start, optimized for streaming
transcode.twoPassHint: Two-pass encoding provides better quality but takes twice as long
transcode.gopSizeHint: Keyframe interval, leave empty for default (usually framerate√ó10)
transcode.customParamsHint: For advanced users only, incorrect parameters may cause failure
transcode.advancedWarning: Advanced options may affect output quality and compatibility, use with caution
transcode.noAudioSelected: No audio tracks selected, will use first track
transcode.subtitleSelectHint: All subtitles will be kept when none are selected
transcode.noVideoInfo: Please select a video file and wait for analysis
transcode.analyzeHint: System needs to read video information first
transcode.noSubtitles: This video has no embedded subtitles
transcode.noSubtitlesHint: Use subtitle burning feature if you need to add subtitles
transcode.removeSubtitlesHint: Will remove all subtitle tracks from the video
transcode.copySubtitlesHint: Keep subtitle tracks in the video, you can select which ones to keep
transcode.audioSelectHint: When no audio tracks are selected, the first track will be used
transcode.h265WarningDesc: H.265 encoded videos may not open in some players (like QuickTime). Consider using H.264 encoding for better compatibility, or use H.265-compatible players (VLC, IINA, etc.).
